abstract.text: A run delegate.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A run delegate is assigned to a run (attribute range) to control typographic traits such glyph ascent, glyph descent, and glyph width.

objects are provided by the owner of a run delegate and are used to modify glyph metrics during layout. The values returned by the delegate are applied to each glyph in the run or runs corresponding to the attribute with that delegate.

abstract.text: Create text layouts, optimize font handling, and access font metrics and glyph data.
The version of the run delegate.
A font object.
A font collection.
A font descriptor.
A frame.
Generate text frames.
Override a font’s specified mapping from Unicode to the glyph ID.
A line of text.
Paragraph or ruler attributes in an attributed string.
A glyph run.
A run delegate.
A structure holding pointers to callbacks implemented by the run delegate.
Creates an immutable instance of a run delegate.
Defines a pointer to a function that is invoked when a CTRunDelegate object is deallocated.
Defines a pointer to a function that determines typographic ascent of glyphs in the run.
Defines a pointer to a function that determines typographic descent of glyphs in the run.
Returns a run delegate’s “refCon” value.
Returns the type of CTRunDelegate objects.
Defines a pointer to a function that determines the typographic width of glyphs in the run.
A tab in a paragraph style, storing an alignment type and location.
A typesetter which performs line layout.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
